Secs. 10-611—10-699. - Reserved. ARTICLE XVI. - SEXUALLY ORIENTED BUSINESSES DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY
Sec. 10-700. - Purpose, findings, intent, and incorporation of recitals. (a) Purpose. It is the purpose of this article to regulate sexually oriented businesses in order to promote and protect the public health, safety, good order, and general welfare of the citizens of the city, to establish reasonable and uniform regulations of sexually oriented businesses within the city. The provisions of this article have neither the purpose nor effect of imposing an unreasonable limitation or unreasonable restriction on the content of any lawful communicative materials including sexually oriented materials. Similarly, it is not the intent nor effect of this article to unreasonably restrict or deny access by adults to sexually oriented materials protected by the First Amendment or to deny access by the distributors and exhibitors of sexually oriented entertainment protected by the First Amendment to their intended market. Neither is it the intent nor effect of this article to condone or legitimize the distribution of obscene or otherwise illegal material. (b) Findings. Based on evidence concerning the adverse secondary effects of adult uses on the community presented in hearings and in reports made available to the council, as contained in the report to the mayor and city council of the city on regulation of sexually oriented businesses, prepared by the city attorney and on file with the office of the city clerk, and other matters and documents relating to all of the above, which report and materials hereby are incorporated by this reference, the city council finds: (1) Sexually oriented businesses lend themselves to ancillary unlawful and unhealthy activities that are presently uncontrolled or not adequately controlled by the operators of the establishments or businesses. Further, there are presently no mechanisms or inadequate mechanisms to make the owners of these businesses or establishments responsible for the activities that occur on their premises. (2) Sexually oriented businesses can lead to significant negative secondary effects, such as increased crime rates and increased ambient crime risk in the surrounding areas. (3) The negative secondary effects associated with sexually oriented businesses are present in urban environments, suburban environments, and in rural areas. (4) The negative secondary effects of sexually oriented businesses can be associated with all business models, including those that provide adult entertainment only for off-site consumption. (5) The negative secondary effects of sexually oriented businesses are exacerbated by allowing such businesses to cluster together. (6) The negative secondary effects associated with the presence of sexually oriented businesses in small towns are likely to be magnified beyond that which would be expected in larger cities because of the more compact nature of downtowns and their relationship to surrounding neighborhoods. (7) Certain workers of certain sexually oriented businesses defined in this article engage in a higher incidence of certain types of illicit sexual behavior than workers of other business establishments. (8) Sexual acts, including masturbation, and oral and anal sex, occur at sexually oriented businesses, especially those which provide private or semi-private areas, booths or cubicles for viewing films, videos, live sex shows and those having physical interaction between workers and customers. (9) Offering and providing such private spaces encourages such previously mentioned activities, which create unhealthy conditions. (10) Persons frequent certain adult theaters, adult video facilities, and other sexually oriented businesses for the purpose of engaging in sex within the premises of such businesses and establishments. (11) Sanitary conditions in some sexually oriented businesses are unhealthy, in part because the activities conducted there are unhealthy and, in part because of the unregulated nature of the activities and the failure of owners and operators of the facilities to self-regulate those activities and maintain those facilities. (12) Studies and reports have determined that semen is found in the areas of sexually oriented businesses where persons view "adult" oriented films. (13) The findings noted in paragraphs (1)—(12), and as set forth hereinafter raise substantial governmental concerns. (14) Sexually oriented businesses have operational characteristics that should be reasonably regulated in order to protect those substantial governmental concerns. (15) A reasonable licensing procedure is an appropriate mechanism to place the burden of that reasonable regulation on the owners and the operators of the sexually oriented businesses. Further, such a licensing procedure will place a heretofore nonexistent incentive on the operators to see that the business or establishment is run in a manner consistent with the good order, health, safety and welfare of its patrons and workers, as well as the citizens of the city. It is appropriate to require reasonable assurances that the licensee is the actual operator of the business or establishment, fully in possession and control of the premises and activities occurring therein. (16) Removal of doors on adult booths and requiring sufficient lighting on premises with adult booths advances a substantial governmental interest in curbing the illegal and unsanitary sexual activity occurring in adult theaters and adult video facilities. (17) Requiring licensees of sexually oriented businesses to keep information regarding current workers and certain past workers will help reduce the incidence of certain types of criminal behavior by facilitating the identification of potential witnesses or suspects and by preventing minors from working at such businesses and establishments. (18) The disclosure of certain information by those persons ultimately responsible for the day-to-day operation and maintenance of the sexually oriented business, where such information is substantially related to the significant governmental interest in the operation of such uses, will aid in preventing the spread of sexually transmitted diseases. (19) The fact that an applicant for a sexually oriented business license has been convicted of a sexually related crime leads to the rational assumption that the applicant may engage in that conduct in contravention of this article. (20) Commercial establishments exist in nearby cities and counties in Georgia where sexually oriented material is possessed, displayed, exhibited, distributed and/or sold for commercial purposes in the form of books, magazines, periodicals or other printed material, or photographs, films, motion pictures, prints, videotapes, slides, computer digital graphic recordings or other visual representations or recordings, or recordings or other audio matter, or instruments, novelties, devices, or paraphernalia which depict, illustrate, describe or relate to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas. (21) Commercial establishments exist in nearby cities or counties in Georgia where sexually oriented commercial activities in the form of nude, semi-nude, or topless dancers, entertainers, performers, or other individuals, who, for commercial gain, perform or are presented while displaying or exposing specified anatomical areas; or engage in straddle dancing or touching with customers. (22) Commercial sexually oriented businesses exist in nearby cities or counties in Georgia where sexually oriented services are offered for commercial or pecuniary gain in the form of commercial physical contact, and other services providing sexual encounters. The workers of such sexually oriented businesses operating in Georgia engage in physical contact or touching with customers including, but not limited to, acts of prostitution, or encourage or entice the customers to engage in lewdness. (23) The activities occurring at sexually oriented businesses occur at establishments and businesses which operate primarily for the purpose of making a profit and, as such, are subject to regulation by the city in the interest of the good order, health, safety, economy, property values, and general welfare of the people, businesses and industries of the city. (24) When the activities occurring at sexually oriented businesses are present in establishments and businesses, other activities which are illegal, unsafe, or unhealthful tend to accompany them, concentrate around them, and be aggravated by them. Such other activities include, but are not limited to, prostitution, pandering, solicitation for prostitution, lewd and lascivious behavior, exposing minors to harmful materials, possession, distribution and transportation of obscene materials, sale or possession of controlled substances, and violent crimes against persons and property. (25) When the activities occurring at sexually oriented businesses are competitively exploited in establishments and businesses, they tend to attract an undesirable number of transients, blight neighborhoods, adversely affect neighboring businesses, lower real property values, promote the particular crimes described above and, ultimately, lead residents and businesses to move to other locations. (26) The activities occurring at sexually oriented businesses sometimes occur in establishments and businesses concurrent with the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages which concurrence leads to a further increase in criminal activity, unsafe activity, and disturbances of the peace and order of the surrounding community and creates additional hazards to the health and safety of customers and workers, and further depreciates the value of adjoining real property harming the economic welfare of the surrounding community and adversely affecting the quality of life, commerce, and community environment. (27) Physical contact or touching within sexually oriented businesses between workers exhibiting specified anatomical areas and customers poses a threat to the health of both, and promotes the spread of communicable and social diseases. (28) In order to preserve and safeguard the good order, health, safety, and general welfare of the people of the city it is necessary and advisable for the city to regulate the conduct of owners, managers, operators, agents, workers, entertainers, performers, and customers at sexually oriented businesses. (29) The potential dangers to the good order, health, safety, and general welfare of the people of the city posed by permitting a sexually oriented business to operate without first meeting the requirements for obtaining a license under this article are so great as to require the licensure of such establishments prior to their being permitted to operate. (30) Requiring operators of sexually oriented businesses to keep records of information concerning workers and certain recent past workers as well as customer contacts and other matters and materials will help reduce the incidence of certain types of criminal behavior by facilitating the identification of potential witnesses or suspects and by making it difficult for minors to work at or be customers in such establishments. (31) Prohibiting sexually oriented businesses from operating within set distances of educational institutions, religious institutions, residences, areas zoned or designated for residential use, and parks at which minors are customarily found, will serve to protect minors from the adverse effects of the activities that accompany such establishments and businesses. (32) Straddle dancing, unregulated private performances, and enclosed adult booths in sexually oriented businesses have resulted in indiscriminate commercial sex between strangers, and pose a threat to the health of the participants and promotes the spread of communicable sexually transmitted diseases. Straddle dancing is primarily conduct rather than communication or expression. (33) Sexually oriented businesses involve some activities that are pure conduct engaged in for the purpose of making a profit, rather than speech or expressive activity and, therefore, are subject to and require increased regulation to protect the health, good order, morals, welfare and safety of the community. (34) The general welfare, health, good order, and safety of the citizens of the city will be promoted by the enactment of this article. (c) Intent. It is the intent of this article to protect and preserve the good order, health, peace, safety, and welfare of the citizens of the City of Porterdale. This article regulates conduct and is not an ordinance that affects the use of land as contemplated by O.C.G.A. § 36-66-1 et seq. (d) Authority. This article is enacted under the constitutionally derived home rule power of the city in the interest of the good order, health, peace, safety, and general welfare of the people of the city. (e) Recitals. It is the city council's further intention to accomplish those intents and purposes expressed by the city council in the recitals of the ordinance from which this section derives, each of which are incorporated by reference into this section. (f) Speech protection. Nothing herein shall be construed to prohibit constitutionally protected expression or speech. This article is intended to reasonably regulate sexually oriented businesses which engage in commercial activities involving acts or services of a sexually explicit nature or which involve acts or services involving matters which are sexual in nature. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-701. - Definitions. The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: Adult bookstore means an establishment which, as a substantial business purpose, offers or provides books, magazines, films, periodicals, videotapes, compact disks, video disks or software (whether for viewing on- or off-premises by use of motion picture machines, televisions, monitors, computers or other image-producing device), periodicals, or other printed or pictorial materials which are intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to customers, and which are distinguished by or characterized by an emphasis on matter depicting or relating to specified sexual activities, or specified anatomical areas. Adult cabaret means a nightclub, bar, dance establishment, juice bar, restaurant, bottle club, or similar commercial establishment that regularly features live conduct characterized by semi-nudity. No establishment shall avoid classification as an adult cabaret by offering or featuring nudity. Adult movie theater means an establishment which, as a substantial business purpose, offers or provides the exhibition to customers of motion pictures, films, videocassettes, slides or similar photographic reproductions characterized by the depiction or description of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas and are intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to such customers. Adult semi-nude modeling studio means a place where persons regularly appear in a state of semi-nudity for money or any form of consideration in order to be observed, sketched, drawn, painted, sculptured, photographed or similarly depicted by other persons. This definition does not apply to any place where persons appearing in a state of semi-nudity do so in a class operated: (1) By a college, junior college, or university supported entirely or partly by taxation; (2) By a private college or university which maintains and operates educational programs in which credits are transferable to a college, junior college, or university supported entirely or partly by taxation; or (3) In a structure: a. Which has no sign visible from the exterior of the structure and no other advertising that indicates a semi-nude person is available for viewing; and b. Where, in order to participate in a class a student must enroll at least three days in advance of the class. Adult video facility means a commercial establishment which, as a substantial business purpose, offers or provides films, motion pictures, videocassette projections, slides, photographs or other visual media characterized by depiction of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas which are shown in the regular course of business. Adult video facility does not include a theater where all viewing occurs in a common area with seating for 50 or more persons. Adult video store means: (1) An establishment having as its stock in trade videotapes or movies or other reproductions, whether for sale or rent, which are distinguished or characterized by their emphasis on matter depicting, describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas; (2) An establishment with a segment or section, comprising ten percent or more of its total floor space, devoted to the sale or display of such material; or (3) An establishment which derives more than ten percent of its gross sales from videos or movies or other reproductions which are characterized or distinguished by their emphasis on matter depicting, describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas. Applicant means the intended operator of a sexually oriented business. Characterized by means describing the essential character or quality of an item. As applied in this article, no business shall be classified as a sexually oriented business by virtue of showing, selling, or renting materials rated NC-17 or R by the Motion Picture Association of America. City means the City of Porterdale, Georgia. Conduct or conducts any business in a sexually oriented business means any one or more of the following: (1) Operates a cash register, cash drawer or other depository on the sexually oriented business premises where cash funds, records of credit cards, or other credit transactions generated in any manner by the operation of the establishment or the activities conducted in the establishment, are kept; (2) Displays, or takes orders from any customer for any merchandise, goods, entertainment or other services offered on the sexually oriented business premises; (3) Delivers or provides to any customer any merchandise, goods, entertainment or other services offered on the sexually oriented business premises; (4) Acts as a door attendant to regulate entry of customers or other persons into the sexually oriented business premises; or (5) Supervises or manages other persons in the performance of any of the foregoing activities on the sexually oriented business premises. Customer means any person who: (1) Is allowed to enter a sexually oriented business in return for the payment of an admission fee or any other form of consideration or gratuity; (2) Enters a sexually oriented business and purchases, rents, or otherwise partakes of any merchandise, goods, entertainment or other services offered; or (3) Is a member of and on the premises of a sexually oriented business operating as a private club. Employ, employee and employment describe and pertain to any person who "conducts any business" on the premises of a sexually oriented business, on a full-time, part-time, or contract basis, regardless of whether the person is denominated an employee, independent contractor, agent, lessee, or otherwise. Employee does not include a person exclusively on the premises for repair or maintenance of the premises or for the delivery of goods to the premises. Exterior portion means any part of the physical structure of a sexually oriented business, including a wall, veneer, door, fence, roof, roof covering, or window, which is visible from any public way or public property. Library means any building open to the general public which contains a collection of books for use by the general public. License means authorization by the city to operate a sexually oriented business. This license is sometimes referred to as a sexually oriented business license. Operator means the manager or other natural person principally in charge of a sexually oriented business. Owner means the proprietor if a sole proprietorship; all general partners if a partnership; or all officers, directors, and persons holding 20 percent or more of the outstanding shares if a corporation; or all members if a limited liability company. The terms "public park" shall not include parkways, public roads, rights-of-way, traffic circles or easements. Semi-nude or semi-nudity means the showing of the female breast below a horizontal line across the top of the areola and extending across the width of the breast at that point, or the showing of the male or female buttocks. This definition shall include the lower portion of the human female breast, but shall not include any portion of the cleavage of the human female breasts exhibited by a bikini, dress, blouse, shirt, leotard, or similar wearing apparel provided the areola is not exposed in whole or in part. The term shall not be construed to include: (1) Any business operated by or employing state licensed psychologists, licensed physical therapists, licensed athletic trainers, licensed cosmetologists, or licensed barbers performing functions authorized under the state licenses held, and not performed for entertainment purposes; (2) Any business operated by or employing state licensed physicians or state licensed chiropractors engaged in practicing the healing arts. Specified anatomical areas mean those areas of the human body which are: (1) Any of the following in a state that is less than completely and opaquely covered: a. The male or female genitals; b. The male or female pubic area; c. The vulva; d. The anus; e. The penis; f. The scrotum; g. The anal cleft; g. The areola on the breast of a female; i. The nipple on the breast of a female; j. The female breast below a line immediately above the top of the areola said line running horizontal across the top of the entire breast, but shall not include any portion of the cleavage between the human female breasts typically exhibited by a dress, blouse, shirt, leotard, bathing suit, or other wearing apparel, provided that the areola is not exposed; k. Sec. 10-702. - Administrative authority and procedure. (a) The administration of this article, including the duty of prescribing forms, is vested in the city manager, except as otherwise specifically provided. The police chief, city zoning administrator, and city code enforcement officer shall render assistance in the administration and enforcement of this article as follows: (1) The police chief shall make police department facilities and personnel available to photograph an applicant for a license. The cost of photographing shall be paid by the applicant at the time the service is provided. Photographs so obtained shall be maintained by the city clerk in the normal course of business. (2) The police chief shall have a criminal history inquiry conducted on all persons listed as applicants in a license application. The inquiry shall be limited to determining whether an applicant for a license has a criminal conviction for a specified criminal act or for an act described in section 10-708(c)(13), for the period indicated. The police chief shall notify the city manager if such criminal conviction is found to exist. (3) The city zoning administrator shall notify the city manager whether an applicant or designated license holder in a license application has failed to comply with or is in violation of applicable provisions of the zoning ordinances, or other land use ordinances and regulations of the city relating to the business to be operated under the license. (4) The city code enforcement officer is responsible for inspecting establishments in order to ascertain compliance with all applicable building codes, statutes, ordinances and regulations, and shall notify the city manager whether an applicant or designated license holder in a license application has failed to comply with or is in violation of applicable provisions of this article governing the design, construction, and maintenance of the premises where the sexually oriented business is or is proposed to be operated. (5) The Newton County Fire Marshal is responsible for inspecting establishments and businesses in order to ascertain compliance with all applicable fire codes, statutes, ordinances, and regulations. (6) Nothing in this section 10-702(a) is intended to prohibit or restrict the police chief or zoning administrator from providing additional assistance as may derive from their normal duties and responsibilities, or as may be requested by the city manager. In no event shall any assistance as described in this section, or the absence of such assistance, delay or extend the time period specified in section 10-711 for the city manager to act on a license application. (b) An application for a license or for the renewal of a license made pursuant to this article shall be submitted to the city manager, who shall grant or deny the application in accordance with the provisions of this article. The city manager also shall suspend or revoke a license in accordance with the provisions of this article. (c) A license issued pursuant to this article shall expire on December 31st of the year in and for which it is issued and may be renewed annually. (d) A license, if granted, shall state on its face: (1) The name and address of the license holder; (2) The name and address of the licensed premises; (3) The date of issuance of the license; (4) The particular classification of sexually oriented business for which the license is granted; and (5) The license number. (e) The license of the sexually oriented businesses shall be classified as follows, based upon the information in the application and subject to subsequent inspection for verification: (1) Adult bookstore; (2) Adult cabaret; (3) Adult semi-nude modeling studio; (4) Adult movie theater; (5) Adult video facility; (6) Adult video store; or (7) Sexual device shop. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-703. - Penalty. (a) Violation of any requirement or prohibition stated in this article is a misdemeanor, punishable upon conviction by a fine of not more than $1,000.00 and/or by imprisonment for not more than six months. With respect to a violation that is continuous in nature, each day that the violation continues shall constitute a separate offense. (b) The revocation or suspension of any license shall not prohibit the imposition of a criminal penalty, and the imposition of a criminal penalty shall not prevent the revocation or suspension of a license. Imposition of a criminal penalty shall not be a prerequisite to the revocation or suspension of a license. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-704. - Injunction. The operation of a sexually oriented business without a valid license in violation of this article shall constitute a nuisance, and any person who operates or causes to be operated such business shall be subject to a suit for injunctive relief as well as prosecution for criminal violations. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-705. - Appeals. Any person or persons severally or jointly aggrieved by any decision, action, or unduly delayed action by the mayor and city council under sections 10-712 or 10-719, may take an appeal to the Superior Court of Newton County in accordance with the statutes governing such actions. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) DIVISION 3. - BUSINESS LICENSE
Sec. 10-706. - Purpose and intent. It is the purpose of this article to regulate sexually oriented businesses to promote the health, safety, morals and general welfare of the citizens of the city, and to establish reasonable and uniform regulations to prevent deleterious effects of sexually oriented businesses within the city. The provisions of this article have neither the purpose nor effect of imposing a limitation or restriction on the content of any communicative materials, including sexually oriented materials. Similarly, it is not the intent nor effect of this article to restrict or deny access by adults to sexually oriented materials protected by the First Amendment, or to deny access by the distributors and exhibitors of sexually oriented entertainment to their intended market. Neither is it the intent or effect of this article to in any way condone or legitimize the distribution of obscene material or material harmful to minors. Rather, it is the purpose of the article to regulate sexually oriented business establishments to prevent increases in criminal activity and undesirable community conditions. It is recognized that such regulation cannot approach prohibition, or a protected form of expression would vanish. Therefore, this article represents an attempt to balance the competing interests of reduced criminal activity and neighborhood protection versus the rights of sexually oriented business establishments and patrons. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-707. - License required. (a) It shall be unlawful for a person to operate a sexually oriented business without a valid license issued pursuant to this article for the particular classification of sexually oriented business sought to be operated, which license shall not be under suspension or permanently or conditionally revoked. No license so issued shall condone or make legal any activity under the license if the activity is deemed illegal or unlawful under the laws of the state or of the United States. (b) It shall be unlawful for a person to operate a sexually oriented business in an establishment that is licensed to sell or dispense alcoholic beverages under chapter 4 of this Code. (c) It shall be unlawful for a person to operate a sexually oriented business under any name or designation, or under any premises name or designation, or at any premises address not specified in a valid license issued pursuant to this article. Each additional premises sought to be operated as a sexually oriented business shall require a separate license. (d) It shall be unlawful for any operator of a sexually oriented business to hire or engage any employee or manager who does not hold a valid permit as required under this article. (e) It shall be unlawful for any person to own, operate or conduct any business in a sexually oriented business located within the city unless the license is posted at or near the principal public entrance to the sexually oriented business in such a manner that it will be conspicuous to patrons who enter the premises. (f) In any prosecution under this section, it shall be presumed that there was no license at the time of the alleged offense unless a license was then posted as provided in subsection (e) of this section 10-707. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-708. - Application. (a) A person who wishes to operate a sexually oriented business shall make application for a license in person at the office of the city manager. The application shall be on a form prescribed by the city manager and obtainable from the city clerk. The application shall be signed under oath by each individual listed as an applicant, and notarized. An application shall be deemed filed with the city when the city clerk has received the required fee in full, the completed application with all information required in subsections (c) and (d) of this section 10-708, and the photograph of each applicant. The application shall be in duplicate, including all addendum or attachments, with one copy being kept on file with the city clerk's office and one copy being transmitted to the police chief. (b) If a person who wishes to operate a sexually oriented business is an individual, that individual must be listed in the application for the license as the applicant and also as the designated license holder. If a person who wishes to operate a sexually oriented business is a legal entity other than an individual, each officer, manager or general partner of the entity, and any other individual who will participate directly in decisions relating to management of the sexually oriented business, must be listed in an application as an applicant, with the individual appearing in person to make application being further designated as the primary applicant with general authority to act on behalf of the entity in connection with the application, and the entity listed as the designated license holder. Each applicant shall provide his or her photograph as provided in subsection (a) of this section 10-708. (c) In addition to such other information as may be requested on the face of the application form, the application shall include the following information: (1) The name, address, and business mailing address (if different from the premises address), and telephone number of the proposed sexually oriented business: a. A statement as to whether the premises to be regulated are owned, rented, or to be rented, by the applicant or licensee and, if the premises are rented or to be rented, a written consent from the property owner to the submission of the application. (2) The name, address and telephone number, and social security number (or federal tax identification number) of the designated license holder; (3) Where the entity seeking to operate the sexually oriented business is something other than an individual: a. If the applicant is a corporation, the name of the corporation shall be set forth exactly as shown in its articles of incorporation or charter, together with the place and date of incorporation, the names and addresses of each of its current officers and directors, and shareholders holding more than 20 percent of any class of corporate stock. b. If the applicant is a limited liability company, the names and addresses of each of its members and managers, if applicable. c. If the applicant is a partnership, the applicant shall set forth the name, residence address, and dates of birth of the partners. d. If one or more of the partners in a partnership form of entity is a corporation, the provisions of this subsection pertaining to corporations shall apply to each such corporate partner. e. The applicant corporation or partnership shall designate one of its officers or general partners to act as its responsible managing officer for purposes of the sexually oriented business. Such designated persons shall complete and sign all application forms required of an individual applicant under this section, but only one application fee shall be charged. (4) The name under which the sexually oriented business is to be operated and a general description of the business to be operated. If applicant is a person doing business under a trade name, the materials required under section 10-708(d)(3) shall be submitted with the application; (5) An accurate, to-scale, but not necessarily professionally drawn, floor plan or diagram of the business premises clearly showing the configuration of the premises, including a statement of total floor space occupied by the business, the place at which the license will be conspicuously posted if granted, the location of all managers' stations and overhead lighting fixtures, and clearly designating all portions of the premises in which patrons will not be permitted. Each diagram should be oriented to the north or to some designated street or object and shall be drawn to a designated scale or with marked dimensions sufficient to show the various internal dimensions of all areas of the interior of the premises to an accuracy of plus or minus six inches. The city manager may waive the foregoing diagram for renewal applications if the applicant adopts a diagram that was previously submitted and certifies that the configuration of the premises has not been altered since it was prepared; (6) If the sexually oriented business is in operation, the date on which the owners have contracted to acquire the sexually oriented business for which the license is sought, and the date on which the sexually oriented business began operations as a sexually oriented business at the location for which the license is sought; (7) If the sexually oriented business is not in operation, the expected start-up date (which shall be expressed in number of days from the date of issuance of the license); (8) Each applicant's full true name, and any other names, aliases or stage names used by the applicant in the five-year period preceding the date of the application; (9) Each applicant's current residential mailing address and telephone number, which information shall be forwarded in writing to the city clerk by letter postmarked no later than ten days after any change in this information; (10) Written proof of each applicant's age, in the form of either a current driver's license with photograph, or other photographic identification, issued by an appropriate governmental agency; (For purposes of this paragraph, a certified copy of the applicant's birth certificate together with a signed and notarized affidavit attaching a photograph of the individual and attesting that the photograph is a true and accurate image of the individual, or current passport, shall suffice in lieu of a current driver's license.) (11) The issuing jurisdiction and the effective date of any license relating to the operation of a sexually oriented business, or relating to employment at a sexually oriented business, which is held or has been held at any time by the applicant or by the designated license holder, whether or not any such license has been revoked or suspended and, if any such license has been revoked or suspended, a complete statement of the reason or reasons for revocation or suspension; (12) A statement of whether an applicant has been convicted of or has pled guilty or nolo contendere to a specified criminal activity as defined in this article and, if so, each specified criminal activity involved, including the date, place, and jurisdiction of each as well as the dates of conviction and release from confinement, where applicable. The fact that a conviction is being appealed shall have no effect on the requirements of this subsection. (13) Any felony or misdemeanor conviction for a crime involving moral turpitude in the five years prior to the date of application for license committed by the applicant, or by the intended license holder, or by any partners, members, managers, corporate officers, directors, or shareholders holding more than 20 percent of any class of corporate stock; (14) The name and address of the statutory agent or other agent authorized to receive service of process. If the statutory agent or other agent authorized to receive service of process is not a resident of Newton County, Georgia, than the applicant shall identify a registered agent upon whom any process, notice or demand required or permitted hereunder or otherwise required or permitted by law may be served who is a resident of Newton County, Georgia; and (15) The names of the sexually oriented business managers who will have actual supervisory authority over the operation of the business, which information shall be forwarded in writing to the city clerk by letter postmarked no later than ten days after any change in this information. (d) The application shall be accompanied by the following: (1) Payment in full of the fee required in section 10-710; (2) Current photograph of each applicant; (3) A copy of the trade name certificate filed in compliance with the trade name statute of the Official Code of Georgia, if the sexually oriented business is to be operated under a trade name; (4) If the sexually oriented business is a Georgia corporation, a copy of the Articles of Incorporation together with any and all amendments thereto; (5) If the sexually oriented business is a foreign corporation, a copy of the certificate of authority to transact business in this state, together with all amendments thereto, if any; (6) If the applicant is a limited liability company, a copy of its articles of organization filed with the Secretary of State; (7) If the sexually oriented business is a limited partnership formed under the laws of this state, a copy of the certificate of limited partnership, together with all amendments, filed in the office of the Secretary of State; (8) If the sexually oriented business is a foreign limited partnership, a copy of the certificate of limited partnership and the qualification documents, together with all amendments, filed in the office of the Secretary of State; (9) If the premises upon which the sexually oriented business is to be operated is leased, then a copy of the lease contract; (10) An appropriate affidavit under the provisions of O.C.G.A. § 36-60-6, verifying participation in the federal work authorization program or verifying that the provisions of O.C.G.A. § 36-60-6 do not apply, as may be applicable; (11) An appropriate affidavit under the provisions of O.C.G.A. § 50-36-1, relating to the applicant's lawful presence in the United States; (12) Pursuant to O.C.G.A. §§ 35-3-35(a) and 35-35(a)(1.2), written authorization for release of personal information and criminal history record information; (13) Any of the materials listed in subsections (d)(2)—(d)(9) above shall not be required for a renewal application if the applicant states that the documents previously furnished to the city manager with the original application or previous renewals remain correct and current. (e) The application shall contain a statement under oath that: (1) The applicant has personal knowledge of the information contained in the application and that the information contained in and furnished with the application is true and correct; (2) That the applicant has read the provisions of this article; and (3) That the sexually oriented business meets or will meet all applicable city ordinances and state laws and regulations. (f) A separate application and license shall be required for each sexually oriented business. (g) The application for license does not authorize the engaging in, operation of, conducting of, or carrying on any sexually oriented business. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-709. - Notice of application for license to operate a sexually oriented business. (a) Advertisement. The applicant for a sexually oriented business license shall give notice that an application has been filed by publication of an advertisement once a week for two consecutive weeks beginning the week immediately following the submission of the application, in a newspaper in which legal advertisements are published in Newton County, Georgia. Said notice need not appear on the same day as legal advertisements are regularly published. The advertisement shall contain a particular description of the location of the proposed business and the name of the applicant or business designees named in the application. (b) Sign. Within three business days of the submission of the application, a printed notice not less than 18 inches by 18 inches, with letters at least two inches in size, shall be placed on the front door or entrance of the building of the proposed location of the sexually oriented business, or on a sign in a prominent place on the lot of the building of the proposed location, stating than an application has been submitted for a sexually oriented business license, and giving the name of the applicant. The costs of printing shall be borne by the applicant. Said notice shall remain displayed until final action on the application for license. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-710. - Fees. Every application for issuance or renewal of a sexually oriented business license shall be accompanied by a non-prorated and non-refundable application fee to defray, in part, the costs of investigation and report required by this article. Such fee shall be according to a fee schedule adopted by the city council. The city clerk shall issue a receipt showing that such fee has been paid. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-711. - Issuance or denial. (a) Within 45 days after the application for a sexually oriented business license is filed with the city, the city manager shall mail to the designated license holder a license or a written notice of intent to deny. (b) The city manager shall issue a license to the applicant unless one or more of the following conditions exists: (1) The applicant's sexually oriented business is located within 1,000 feet of any religious institution, school, governmental building, library, public park, playground, licensed day-care center, or within 500 feet of property used or zoned for residential purposes, with measurements being made by a registered land surveyor in a straight line, without regard to intervening structures or objects, from the nearest point on the property line of the applicant's sexually oriented business to the nearest point on the property line of such religious institution, school, governmental building, library, public park, playground, licensed day-care center, or property used or zoned for residential purposes; (2) The applicant's sexually oriented business is located within 1,000 feet of any other sexually oriented business for which there is a license under this article, or within 1,000 feet of any parcel of land upon which any establishment selling alcoholic beverages is located, with measurement being made by a registered land surveyor in a straight line, without regard to intervening structures or objects, from the nearest point on the property line of the applicant's sexually oriented business to the nearest point on the property line of any other sexually oriented business or establishment selling alcoholic beverages; (3) The applicant's sexually oriented business is located in a section of the city that is zoned other than LI (Light Industry); (4) The applicant holds a license, issued under chapter 4 of this Code of Ordinances, to sell or dispense alcoholic beverages upon the premises of the intended sexually oriented business; (5) The applicant failed to supply all of the information requested on the application; (6) The applicant gave materially false, fraudulent, or untruthful information on the application; (7) The applicant, or the intended license holder, has been convicted of a specified criminal act within the time periods as described in section 10-708(c)(12), or has been convicted of a criminal act within the time periods as described in section 10-708(c)(13); (8) The application or the sexually oriented business does not meet any other requirement of this article; (9) The operator has had a license revoked for the same sexually oriented business within the 12 month period immediately preceding the date that the application was filed. The fact that a revocation is being appealed shall have no effect; (10) The applicant has not demonstrated that the owner of the sexually oriented business owns or holds a lease for the property or the applicable portion thereof upon which the sexually oriented business will be situated, or has a legally enforceable right to occupy the property; (11) The applicant, the applicant's spouse, or the designated license holder is delinquent in payment to the city for taxes, fees, fines, or penalties assessed against or imposed upon the applicant, the applicant's spouse, or the designated license holder in relation to a sexually oriented business or arising out of any other business activity owned or operated by the applicant, the applicant's spouse, or the designated license holder and licensed by the city; (12) The applicant or the designated license holder has failed to comply with or is in violation of applicable provisions of the zoning ordinances or the building codes, development standards, or other land use ordinances and regulations of the city relating to the business or activity to be conducted under the license; (13) Within the past two years, the applicant or the designated license holder has had a license similar to that authorized under this article, but issued in another jurisdiction, revoked on the basis of conduct which would be ground for revocation of a license issued under this article if committed in the city. The fact that the revocation is being appealed at the time of the decision on this application shall have no effect; or (14) The granting of a license would violate a state or federal statute, city ordinance, or a court order. (c) Property uses and distances for original applications shall be determined as of the time that the application is filed. If a renewal application is timely filed as provided in section 10-717, the property uses and measurements for the renewal application shall be determined as of the time that the original application for the sexually oriented business was filed. If not timely filed, renewal applications shall be subject to the same fees and shall be treated in the same manner in all respects as original applications. (d) Provisional license. If the city manager is unable to act on the license application within the required time period following a determination of completeness, he or she shall notify the applicant in writing and issue a provisional license, which shall expire following approval of the application or denial of the application and final disposition of any appeal proceedings as provided in section 10-712, or in section 10-719 if the application is for renewal of a license. The provisions of this article shall apply fully to a provisional license. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-712. - Appeals from denial of license. (a) If the city manager determines that an applicant is not eligible for a license under this article, the applicant shall be given notice in writing of the reasons for the denial within 45 days of the receipt of its application by the city manager, provided that the applicant may request, in writing, that such period be extended for an additional period of not more than ten days at any time before the notice is issued in order to make modifications necessary to comply with section 10-708. An applicant may appeal the decision of the city manager regarding such denial by filing a written request for a hearing with the city clerk within ten days after the applicant has been given notice of such denial. The city manager's decision on the application shall be final unless an appeal is timely filed. An appeal shall not stay the city manager's decision on the issuance of a license. The applicant's written request for a hearing shall set out the grounds on which the denial is challenged. The hearing shall be conducted before the mayor and city council at a reasonable date and time established by the mayor and council after reasonable notice to the applicant. At the hearing, the mayor and city council shall receive oral and written testimony regarding the application. Hearings shall be conducted under procedures established by the mayor and city council, which shall be consistent with the nature of the proceedings and shall ensure that each party may present evidence, cross-examine witnesses and be represented by legal counsel. (b) The mayor and city council shall conduct the hearing within 30 days after receipt of the applicant's written request for a hearing unless the applicant requests an extension in writing. The mayor and city council shall render a written decision and issue notice of the decision to the applicant within ten days after the conclusion of the hearing. The written decision of the mayor and city council shall be final. (c) In any instance in which the applicant's establishment is to be situated within 1,000 feet from another proposed establishment for which a previously filed license application under this article has been denied, and the previously filed application is still subject to appeals, the city manager may grant the license on a conditional basis, subject to the outcome of the appeals on the previous application. A license so issued may be withdrawn and denied effective upon the third day after notice is given to the operator following the resolution of the appeals on the prior license. In case of denial, the applicant shall have the same rights of appeal as if the license had been denied in the first instance. (d) The provisions of subsection (c) of this section 10-712 shall not be construed to prohibit a sexually oriented business for which there is a license from relocating to another location situated within 1,000 feet of its existing location, provided that the proposed location complies with all applicable requirements of this article other than its proximity to its own existing sexually oriented business location. An original license application shall be required to be filed for the proposed relocation, and the city manager shall conditionally grant the application, if granted, on the stipulation that the license will not actually be issued until the applicant discontinues operation at its existing location and surrenders the license for its existing location. Any such relocation must be completed within 180 days from the date the license is conditionally granted, or the conditional grant of the application will become void by reason of passage of time. Pending the removal of the sexually oriented business to its new location, both the old and new locations shall be deemed to be operating under a license for purpose of measurements to locations of other proposed sexually oriented businesses for which applications may be filed. (e) In any instance in which the proposed sexually oriented business tract description submitted by an applicant pursuant to section 10-708 for a license reflects a tract or parcel of land that has resulted from a subdivision of property for which compliance with the applicable subdivision requirements of this Code was required, and the city manager determines that the property has not been lawfully subdivided in accordance with the proper subdivision requirements, the city manager shall cause all measurements and determinations regarding the issuance of the license to be made on the basis of the parent tract from which the subdivision was made, rather than the subdivided tract. Sec. 10-713. - Nontransferability of license; alteration. (a) No license for a sexually oriented business may be sold, transferred or assigned by a licensee, or by operation of law, to any other person(s) or business entity. Any such sale, transfer or assignment, or attempted sale, transfer or assignment, shall be deemed to constitute a voluntary surrender of such license and such license shall thereafter be null and void; provided and excepting, however, that if the licensee is a partnership and one or more of the partners should die, one or more of the surviving partners may acquire, by purchase or otherwise, the interest of the deceased partner or partners without effecting a surrender or termination of such license, and in such case, the license, upon notification to the city, shall be placed in the name of the surviving partner. (b) A license issued to a corporation shall be deemed terminated and void when either any outstanding stock of the corporation is sold, transferred or assigned after the issuance of license, or any stock authorized but not issued at the time of the granting of such license and is thereafter issued and sold, transferred or assigned. (c) A license issued to a limited liability company shall be deemed terminated and void when any members and managers are added who previously have not been identified on the license application. (d) It shall be unlawful for any person to counterfeit, forge, change, deface or alter a license. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-714. - Term; renewal. Each license issued under this article shall be valid until December 31st of the year of issue and shall expire at 11:59 p.m. on December 31st of the year of issue, unless sooner revoked, or surrendered. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-715. - Suspension. The city manager shall suspend a license for a period of 30 days if a licensee is convicted of violating a provision of this article. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-716. - Revocation. (a) The city manager shall revoke a license issued pursuant to this article if the licensee: (1) Knowingly allowed a person under 18 years of age to enter a sexually oriented business; (2) Is convicted of a violation of this article in any 12 month period; (3) Is convicted of any crime on the basis of which a license may be denied under section 10-708(c)(12) or section 10-708(c)(13) of this article; (4) Gave false or misleading information in the application; (5) Failed to operate and keep open the sexually oriented business for a period of 30 consecutive days, unless due to circumstances beyond the control of the owner, and the owner is proceeding with due diligence, given all attendant circumstances, to open or reopen the establishment; (6) Received a license which was erroneously issued by the city manager in contravention of the criteria of this article; (7) Has knowingly operated or worked in the sexually oriented business during a period of time when the license was suspended; or (8) Is delinquent in payment to the city of taxes or fees related to the sexually oriented business or arising out of any other business activity owned or operated by the licensee and licensed by the city. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-717. - Renewal. (a) A license under this article may be renewed by filing an application for renewal on a form provided by the city manager. The application for renewal shall be received by the city manager not less than 45 days before the expiration of the license. When the application for renewal is received less than 45 days before the expiration date, the expiration of the license shall not be delayed, postponed or otherwise affected. (b) The city manager may deny an application for renewal for any reason for which an application may be denied or revoked under this article. (c) An application for issuance or renewal of a sexually oriented business license shall be accompanied by such fee as required under section 10-710. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-718. - Procedure for revocation, suspension, or denial of renewal of existing licenses. (a) If the city manager determines that grounds exist to suspend or revoke a license, or to deny an application for renewal of a license, the city manager shall notify the designated license holder, license applicant or licensee, as applicable and who hereafter are referred to as "respondent", in writing of the intent to deny, suspend or revoke, which notice shall include a summary of the grounds for such action. The notice shall be sent by registered or certified mail to the address of the designated license holder, license applicant, or licensee listed in the current year's license application or renewal application. (b) Within ten days after the effective date of notice, the respondent may provide to the city manager in writing a response, which shall include a statement of reasons why the license or its renewal should not be denied, suspended, or revoked, and which may include a request for a hearing. If a response is not received by the city manager in the time stated, the denial of renewal, suspension, or revocation shall be final; and notice shall be sent to the applicable designated license holder, license applicant or licensee by registered or certified mail. (c) Within ten days after receipt of a response, the city manager shall either withdraw the intent to deny the renewal, suspend, or revoke, and so notify the respondent, or shall deny the renewal, impose a suspension, or revoke the license. Following a decision to deny renewal, suspend, or revoke a license, the city manager shall send notice to the respondent, which shall include a statement of the reasons for the denial, suspension or revocation. The effective date of notice shall be the date the notice is actually received or five days after the date the notice is mailed, whichever occurs first. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-719. - Appeal from suspension, revocation, or denial of renewal of existing license. (a) A licensee may appeal the decision of the city manager regarding a suspension, revocation, or denial of renewal of a license by filing a written request for a hearing with the city manager within ten days after the licensee is given notice of such suspension, revocation, or denial of renewal. The city manager's decision regarding suspension, revocation, or denial of renewal shall be final unless an appeal is timely filed. The licensee's written request for a hearing shall set out the grounds on which the city manager's decision is challenged. The hearing shall be conducted before the mayor and city council at a reasonable date and time established by the mayor and after reasonable notice to the licensee. At the hearing, the mayor and city council shall receive oral and written testimony regarding the suspension, revocation, or denial of renewal. Hearings shall be conducted under procedures established by the mayor, which shall be consistent with the nature of the proceedings and shall ensure that each party may present evidence, cross examine witnesses and be represented by legal counsel. (b) The mayor and city council shall conduct the hearing within 30 days after receipt of the licensee's written request for a hearing unless the licensee requests an extension in writing. The mayor and city council shall render a written decision and issue notice of the decision to the licensee within ten days after the conclusion of the hearing. The written decision of the mayor and city council shall be final. (c) Any person or persons severally or jointly aggrieved by any decision or action of the mayor and city council under this section 10-719, may take an appeal to the Superior Court of Newton County in accordance with the statutes governing such actions. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-720. - Disclosure of information. All information collected by the city under section 10-708 shall be maintained by the office of the city clerk on a confidential basis, and such information may be disclosed only as may be required, and only to the extent required, by governing law or court order. Any information protected by the right of privacy as recognized by state or federal law shall be redacted prior to such disclosure. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-721. - Other regulations. A license required by this article is in addition to any other licenses required by the city, the county, or the state to engage in the business or occupation. Persons engaging in activities described in the article, including the operation of a sexually oriented business, shall comply with all other ordinances and laws, including the zoning ordinances, as may be required, to engage in the business or profession. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) DIVISION 4. - EMPLOYEE PERMITS AND REGULATIONS
Sec. 10-722. - Permits required. (a) It shall be unlawful for any person who does not hold a permit to act as an employee or a sexually oriented business manager of or in a sexually oriented business. (b) It shall be the duty of the operator of a sexually oriented business to ensure that no person acts as an employee or manager of or in the sexually oriented business unless that person holds a permit. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-723. - Application and issuance. (a) Any person who desires to obtain an original or renewal permit under this article shall make application to the city manager in person. The application shall be made under oath upon a form prescribed by the city manager, and shall include: (1) The name, home street address and mailing address (if different) of the applicant; (2) The applicant's age, date and place of birth; (3) Proof of the date of birth of the applicant and the identity of applicant, including at least one photographic identity card issued by a governmental agency; (4) Height, weight, hair and eye color; (5) A statement of whether an applicant has been convicted of or has pled guilty or nolo contendere to a specified criminal activity as defined in the article and, if so, each specified criminal activity involved, including the date, place, and jurisdiction of each as well as the dates of conviction and release from confinement, where applicable; (6) A statement of whether an applicant has been convicted of or has pled guilty or nolo contendere to a criminal act of moral turpitude, as set forth in section 10-708(c)(13); (7) Two passport-type photographs of the applicant of a size specified by the city manager, which shall become part of the photographic identity card if a permit is issued to the applicant; (8) An appropriate affidavit under the provisions of O.C.G.A. § 50-36-1, relating to the applicant's lawful presence in the United States; and (9) Pursuant to O.C.G.A. §§ 35-3-35(a) and 35-3-35(a)(1.2), written authorization for release of personal information and criminal history record information. (b) Each application shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable processing fee in the amount according to a fee schedule adopted by the mayor and city council. (c) The city manager shall issue the permit within 15 days from the date of filing of the application unless he finds that the applicant has been convicted of a specified criminal activity as defined in this article. If the application is not granted, the applicant shall be mailed notice of the grounds and of the applicant's right to provide evidence and request a hearing as provided in this section 10-723, within 15 days from the date of filing of the application. (d) Provisional license. If the city manager is unable to act on the license application within the required time period following a determination of completeness, he or she shall notify the applicant in writing and issue a provisional license, which shall expire following approval of the application or denial of the application and final disposition of any appeal proceedings as provided in section 10-702. The provisions of this article shall apply fully to a provisional license. (e) Each permit issued by the city manager shall consist of two photographic identification cards—a personal card and an on-site card. (f) Any applicant whose application is denied and who requests a hearing on the denial shall be granted a hearing within 15 days following the receipt of the request by the city manager. The hearing shall be conducted as provided in section 10-712. (g) If any personal card or on-site card is lost or stolen, the holder shall immediately notify the city manager and request a replacement, which shall be issued for a fee in the amount according to a fee schedule adopted by the mayor and city council within three days following verification of the identity of the holder. (h) No permit application shall be accepted nor shall a permit be issued to any person who does not provide proof that he or she is at least 18 years of age. Any permit issued by virtue of any misrepresentation or error to any person under the age of 18 years shall be void. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-724. - Term, transfer, amendment. (a) A permit issued under this division is valid for one year from the date of its issuance. (b) A permit is personal to the named permit holder and is not valid for use by any other person. (c) Each permit holder shall notify the city manager of his or her new address within ten days following any change of his or her address. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-725. - Display. (a) Each manager or employee shall conspicuously display his or her personal card upon his or her person at all times while acting as an employee or manager of or in a sexually oriented business. (b) Each manager or employee shall provide his or her on-site card to the manager or on-site manager in charge of the sexually oriented business to hold while the manager or employee is on the premises. (c) In any prosecution under this section 10-725, it shall be presumed that the actor did not have a permit unless the permit was on display as required under subsection (a) of this section 10-725. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-726. - Revocation. If the city manager has reasonable ground to believe that any permit holder has been convicted of a specified criminal activity, or an offense within section 10-708(c)(13) within or after the specified time, or has violated a requirement or prohibition of this article, the city manager may revoke the permit following a notice of the ground or grounds, and a hearing as provided for in section 10-718. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-727. - Sexually oriented business employees. (a) It shall be unlawful for any sexually oriented business to employ any person who has been convicted of a specified criminal act as defined in this article, or who otherwise falls within the provisions of section 10-708(c)(13) of this article. (b) It shall be unlawful for any sexually oriented business to employ any person who is under 18 years of age. (c) For purposes of this section, the term "employ" shall include work done or services performed while in the scope of employment by a sexually oriented business, whether on or off premises. (d) For purposes of this section, independent contractors of a sexually oriented business shall be considered as employees, regardless of the business relationship with the owner or licensee of any sexually oriented business. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-728. - Disclosure of information. All information collected by the city under section 10-723 shall be maintained by the office of the city clerk on a confidential basis, and such information may be disclosed only as may be required, and only to the extent required, by governing law or court order. Any information protected by the right of privacy as recognized by state or federal law shall be redacted prior to such disclosure. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) DIVISION 5. - OPERATIONS REGULATIONS
Sec. 10-729. - Prohibited conduct generally. (a) No patron, employee, or any other person shall knowingly or intentionally, in a sexually oriented business, appear in a state of nudity or engage in a specified sexual activity. (b) No person shall knowingly or intentionally, in a sexually oriented business, appear in a semi-nude condition unless the person is an employee who, while semi-nude, remains at least six feet from all patrons and on a stage at least 24 inches from the floor in a room of at least 600 square feet. The stage shall be separated from the area in which patrons may be present by a solid barrier or railing the top of which is at least three feet in height. An employee present on the stage or patron may not extend any part of his or her body over or beyond the barrier or railing. (c) No employee who appears semi-nude in a sexually oriented business shall knowingly or intentionally touch a customer or the clothing of a customer on the premises of a sexually oriented business. (d) An employee shall not touch the breast, buttocks, or genitals of another employee while on the premises. (e) It shall be unlawful to allow a person who is visibly intoxicated to enter or be on the premises of a sexually oriented business at any time the sexually oriented business is open for business. (f) A sign, in a form prescribed by the city manager summarizing the provisions of subsections (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e) shall be posted near the entrance of the sexually oriented business in such a manner as to be clearly visible to patrons upon entry. No person shall cover, obstruct, or obscure said sign. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-730. - Persons younger than 18 and intoxicated persons prohibited from entry; attendant required. (a) It shall be unlawful to allow a person who is younger than 18 years of age to enter or be on the premises of a sexually oriented business at any time the sexually oriented business is open for business. (b) It shall be unlawful for any person to sell, barter or give, or to offer to sell, barter or give to any minor any service, material, device, or thing sold or offered for sale by a sexually oriented business. (c) It shall be the duty of the operator of each sexually oriented business to ensure that an attendant is stationed at each public entrance to the sexually oriented business at all times during such sexually oriented business' regular business hours. It shall be the duty of the attendant to not allow any person under the age of 18 years to enter the sexually oriented business. It shall be presumed that an attendant knew a person was under the age of 18 unless such attendant asked for and was furnished: (1) A valid operator's, commercial operator's, or chauffeur's driver license; or (2) A valid personal identification certificate issued by the state or another official government agency containing a description of the person so identified, such person's photograph, and such person's date of birth. Appropriate forms of such identification include a passport and military identification card. Appropriate forms of identification shall not include a birth certificate nor any traffic citation or complaint. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-731. - Exterior portions of sexually oriented business. (a) It shall be unlawful for an owner or operator of a sexually oriented business to allow the merchandise or activities of the sexually oriented business to be visible from any point outside such sexually oriented business. (b) It shall be the duty of the owner or operator of a sexually oriented business to opaquely cover each non-opaque area through which a person outside the premises of the sexually oriented business may otherwise see inside the sexually oriented business. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-732. - Alcoholic beverages. (a) It shall be unlawful for an owner, operator or manager of a sexually oriented business to knowingly allow the sale, dispensing, or consumption of alcoholic beverages upon the premises, including all outdoor areas, of a sexually oriented business. (b) It shall be unlawful for an owner, operator or manager of a sexually oriented business to knowingly allow any person, whether a patron, employee or otherwise, to bring any alcoholic beverage onto the premises of the sexually oriented business, including all outdoor areas. ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-733. - Access, visibility, lighting, supervision. (a) It shall be unlawful for any owner, operator or manager of any sexually oriented business to permit any employee to provide any entertainment to any customer in any separate area within a sexually oriented business to which entry or access is blocked or obscured by any door, curtain, or other barrier, regardless of whether entry to such separate area is by invitation, admission fee, club membership fee, or any form of gratuity or consideration. (b) It shall be the duty of any owner, operator or manager of a sexually oriented business to allow immediate access by any police officer, Newton County fire department official or health officer to any portion of the premises of the sexually oriented business upon request for purpose of inspection of such premises for compliance with this article, or any other applicable law. (c) Each sexually oriented business shall be equipped with lighting fixtures of sufficient intensity to illuminate every place to which customers are permitted access at an illumination of not less than five foot-candles as measured at floor level. (d) It shall be the duty of any owner, operator or manager of a sexually oriented business to ensure that at least one on-site manager is on duty on the premises at all times during which the sexually oriented business is open for business or during which customers are on the premises. (e) It shall be the duty of any owner, operator or manager of sexually oriented business to ensure that all persons acting as managers or employees on the premises hold and display permits under division 4 of this article. (f) It shall be the duty of the on-site manager to ensure that no employee or manager is allowed or permitted to conduct any business on the premises of a sexually oriented business unless the on-site manager has in his possession or control an on-site card, as referenced in sections 10-722, and 10-725 for the manager or employee. On-site cards shall be made available for immediate inspection by any police officer, Newton County fire department official or health officer. Managers or employees working at more than one sexually oriented business may retrieve their on-site cards upon departing the premises in order to present them to a manager at any other sexually oriented business where such persons are employed to hold while the manager or employee remains on those premises. (g) It shall be the duty of any owner, operator or manager to maintain a complete list of all persons, including names and addresses, who are employed by or in the sexually oriented business. (h) For licensees offering live entertainment, all portions of the property open to public access, both interior and exterior areas, shall be patrolled continually by security employed by the sexually oriented business establishment specially for that purpose. Security personnel shall be charged with preventing violations of law and enforcing compliance by patrons of the requirements of these regulations. Security personnel shall be uniformed in such a manner so as to be readily identifiable as security personnel by the public. No security guard required pursuant to this subsection shall act as a door person, ticket seller, ticket taker, or admittance person. For licensees not offering live entertainment, security shall be required only if recommended by the police chief, as necessary to ensure compliance with this article. (i) It shall be the duty of an owner and manager of a sexually oriented business to provide that all off-street parking areas and premises entries of the sexually oriented business are illuminated from sunset to one hour following the time of closing of the sexually oriented business with a lighting system which provides an average maintained horizontal illumination of light on the parking surface and/or walkways, as per the requirements of the City of Porterdale Zoning Ordinance. This required lighting level is established in order to provide sufficient illumination of the parking areas and walkways serving the sexually oriented business for the personal safety of patrons and employees and to reduce specified criminal conduct as discussed in section 10-700(b). ( Ord. of 05-07-2018(2) ) Sec. 10-734. - Condition of premises. (a) All premises shall be kept clean and in proper sanitary condition and in accordance with all state laws and local ordinances. Adequate facilities, equipment, and supplies shall be provided to meet this requirement and adequate ventilation and illumination shall be provided to permit a thorough, complete cleaning of the entire licenses premises. Trash and garbage shall not be permitted to accumulate or to become a nuisance on or in the immediate vicinity of the licensed premises but shall be disposed of daily or more frequently if necessary to prevent accumulation. The licensee or the licensee's designee shall make sanitary inspections of the premises at least every seven days. Each licensed premises shall post and maintain, in a readily accessible place, a schedule for maintaining the sanitation of the premises. (b) The premises shall be subject to periodic inspection by the Newton County Health Department, the Newton County Fire Department, the Porterdale Code Enforcement Officer, and police chief.
